newsitem.title: USA: U.S. distillate demand stocks near normal - EIA.
newsitem.headline: U.S. distillate demand stocks near normal - EIA.

text.p: Mild winter weather has helped to beef up U.S. distillate stocks to near normal levels, the Energy Information Administration said Wednesday.
U.S. distillate inventories, including heating oil and diesel, fell 500,000 barrels to 105.3 million barrels last week, but were up 3.4 million barrels from a year ago.
"The 105.3 million barrels reported this week is ... almost within normal bounds," EIA said in its weekly distillate watch.
"Distillate demand has fallen to 3.2 million barrels per day, in reflection of the warmer temperatures that have prevailed across much of the East Coast," it said.
Heating oil production for the week ending February 21 dropped to 1.3 million barrels per day from levels as high as 1.6 million bpd earlier this winter.
Diesel fuel production rose to 1.8 million bpd last week from about 1.7 million bpd the previous week.

Refinery use held at a low 89.7 percent with crude inputs of 13.4 million bpd last week, about the same as the previous week, "indicating that maintenance activity prior to the gasoline season is being completed early this year," EIA said.
